text: RIO DE JANEIRO Cade, Brazils anti-monopoly regulator, has recommended that some of the nations largest fuel distributors be found guilty of anticompetitive practices in the aviation gasoline market, BR Distribuidora said on Friday night.Cades opinion has no immediate legal effect, but the body will present its findings in court, which could lead to significant fines. The nature of the allegations was not immediately clear, but Cade has previously said it was investigating whether those companies were acting to bar competitors entry into the aviation gasoline market at Guarulhos.In the Friday filing, BR Distribuidora said its business model was based on the best commercial and competitive practices, adding that it would adopt all means necessary for its defense.
